sudo_ssh.description: Uses sudo ssh to connect to the host, useful if you want to forward locally ports like 80 or 443

User.description: Used in .ssh/config defaults to the $USER who runs sd2

containers.description: List of containers to run on this host

aliases.description: Names that will be added to /etc/hosts for this container

enabled.descrption: Should the container be started if it is missing

disabled.descrption: Should the container be started if it is missing

remove_if_version_mismatch.description: If the container is running with the wrong image remove it and restart it.

remove_if_running_when_disabled.description: If the container is running and should not remove it.

docker_auth.description: A command to run just before running docker, usually used for authentication

env.description: Environment variables array to be passed to the container

environ.description: Environment variables array to be passed to the container

extra_flags.description: Flags to add to the docker command line

source_root.description: The root of the source directory, required for non abstract workspaces

dest_root.description: The destination directory. Optional, if missing it will be the same the source_root

delete.description: Exact mirror, delete any files that exist only in dest.
